alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 4:56PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Carbon County through 545 PM MDT... At 454 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms extending from 17 miles southwest of Shirley Basin to near Saratoga. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph with locally higher gusts possible. SOURCE...Surface observations. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Saratoga, Hanna, Medicine Bow, Elk Mountain, Battle Mountain, Lincoln Park Campground, Ryan Park, Ryan Park Campground, Bow River Campground, South Brush Creek Campground and Arlington. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 228 and 272. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin
